metadata.title: CVE-2018-1115 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - low
metadata.description:
postgresql before versions 10.4, 9.6.9 is vulnerable in the adminpackextension, the pg_catalog.pg_logfile_rotate() function doesn't follow thesame ACLs than pg_rorate_logfile. If the adminpack is added to a database,an attacker able to connect to it could exploit this to force log rotation.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-1115` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libecpg-compat3 - 10.4-0ubuntu0.18.04
libecpg6 - 10.4-0ubuntu0.18.04
libpgtypes3 - 10.4-0ubuntu0.18.04
libpq5 - 10.4-0ubuntu0.18.04
postgresql-10 - 10.4-0ubuntu0.18.04
postgresql-client-10 - 10.4-0ubuntu0.18.04
postgresql-plperl-10 - 10.4-0ubuntu0.18.04
postgresql-plpython-10 - 10.4-0ubuntu0.18.04
postgresql-plpython3-10 - 10.4-0ubuntu0.18.04
postgresql-pltcl-10 - 10.4-0ubuntu0.18.04
No subscription required

criterions.comment: postgresql-10 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '10.4-0ubuntu0.18.04').
